gameframework.drawing

Interface SpriteManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SpriteManagerDefaultImpl

    public interface SpriteManager
    Manage sprite libraries by displaying the right sprite based on a set of types and an increment for the animation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw(java.awt.Graphics g, java.awt.Point position)
      Draw the sprite at the given position.
      void increment()
      Go to the next sprite in the animation without changing the type.
      void reset()
      Sets the increment to 0.
      void setIncrement(int increment)
      Manually set the increment.
      void setType(java.lang.String type)
      Set the current type the entity has.
      void setTypes(java.lang.String... types)
      Set the different types that the entity being displayed can have.

    • Method Detail

      • setTypes

        void setTypes(java.lang.String... types)
        Set the different types that the entity being displayed can have. The types order must be the same as the one in the picture. For example, if in the picture the first row represents the entity going to the left and the second row represents the entity going to the right, you would call: setTypes("left","right")

      • setType

        void setType(java.lang.String type)
        Set the current type the entity has. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the type is not in the type list as set using setTypes(String...).
        Parameters:
        type -

      • draw

        void draw(java.awt.Graphics g,
          java.awt.Point position)
        Draw the sprite at the given position. Uses the current type and increment to choose the right sprite to display.
        See Also:
        increment(), setType(String)

      • increment

        void increment()
        Go to the next sprite in the animation without changing the type.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Sets the increment to 0.

      • setIncrement

        void setIncrement(int increment)
        Manually set the increment. You won't need that most of the time and will only require increment().
        See Also:
        increment()
